column4: does someone successfully manage to make disc quotas on ubuntu 9.10 with ext4 fs ?
I don't have it currently but I've done quotas on a 9.10 desktop
but with ext4 fs ? because i read in google and there is a bit difference
slightly different implimentations, but the confifguration is the same
can you tell me why i got this error :S http://pastebin.ca/1707541
I can have a look, one moment
what's the permissions on /home/hdtidi/.gvfs ?
have ou fsck'd /home as i suggests ?
yes
w0w.. w8 to paste in pastebin whats the result when i try to see the permissions
looks like a little bit of file system corruption there :)
i run fsck -C -f -v /dev/sda6 (/home partition) but i dont know what to look for.. but i didnt saw any errors what so ever
you didn't do that while its mounted did you ?
phew, remove .gvfs file - reboot it should get recreated, lets see if that's the only corruption
sudo is your friend
whoaaa, you're root
drop into single user mode, do an ls -i on it and remove the inode (dirty hack)
ok - if you're not comfortable with that, this may not be the best way to go, as a mistake could cause you pain
syn-ack i did remove .gvfs not by inode just in init 1 - rm -rf .gvfs .. and it was gone.. but now its the same.. when i execute quotacheck -avugm its still the same error
here?
hi, i am from yesterday with the quota problem remember?
I certainly do
i just wanted to say i got my problem :) i went into init 1 and deleted this .vgs(whatever) and then run the quotaon command and voalq :) after reboot everything was fine
now that is great news, well done
